description: CRITICAL: Classes should be small (under 200-300 lines) with a single responsibility. Keep classes cohesive (methods/data interdependent), eliminate dead code, and favor many small focused classes over few large ones.

do.description: Keep classes small and focused on single responsibility
content: Keep classes cohesive (methods use shared instance variables)
Each class has ONE reason to change
Favor many small classes over few large ones
- High cohesion: methods share instance variables

dont.description: Don't create large god objects with multiple responsibilities
content: Don't let classes grow beyond 200-300 lines
Wrong Examples (too large or multiple responsibilities):
- Low cohesion: methods use different subsets of instance variables
- Extract each responsibility into separate class
- Prefer 5 classes of 100 lines over 1 class of 500 lines
- Use composition to combine small classes
